snippet: The departure of many Western development workers from the West African countries hit hardest by Ebola has further weakened the region’s decrepit, understaffed health systems.
abstract: Departure of many Western development workers from West African countries hit hardest by Ebola virus has further weakened region's understaffed health systems during one of the most volatile health crises ever; international organizations, wealthy countries and charitable groups gear up to fight outbreak but the absence of doctors and volunteers in Liberia, Guinea and Sierra Leone is reminder of the daunting practical obstacles.
lead_paragraph: The departure of many Western development workers from the West African countries hit hardest by Ebola has further weakened the region’s decrepit, understaffed health systems.

headline.main: With Aid Doctors Gone, Ebola Fight Grows Harder
headline.print_headline: As Many Doctors Retreat, Ebola Fight Grows Harder
